Tortuga.

Time to go.

The key.

Meaning William Turner, Captain Sparrow.
You know these clothes do not flatter you at all. It should be a dress or nothing. I happen to have no dress in my cabin.
Jack. I know Will came to find you, where is he?

Darling, I am truly unhappy to have to tell you this, but through an unfortunate and entirely unforeseeable series of circumstances that had nothing whatsoever to do with me, poor Will has been press-ganged into Davy Jones’s Crew.
Davy Jones?
You look bloody awful, what are you doing here?
You smell funny.
Jack!
Hmm.
All I want is to find Will.

Of course.
Because I would think, you’d want to find a way to save Will most.
And you’d have a way of doing that?

A chest of unknown size and origin.
And whoever possesses that chest, possesses the leverage to command Jones to do whatever it is he or she wants. Including saving brave William from his grim fate.
How do we find it?
With this.  My compass… is unique.
True enough.  This compass does not point north.
Where does it point?
It points to the thing you want most in this world.
Jack.  Are you telling the truth?
Every word, love. And what you want most in this world…  is to find the chest of Davy Jones, is it not?
To save Will.
By finding the chest of Davy Jones.  Mr. Gibbs!
We have our heading.
I understand. It’s a game of deception. The game includes all the dice, not just your own. What are they waging?
So any Crew member can be challenged?
I challenge Davy Jones.
My soul. An eternity of servitude.
I want this.
That’s not part of the game, is it?  You can still walk away.

Four five’s.
Eight five’s.
Fool. Why did you do that?

They’ll know you helped me.
I promise.
Beckett.
Yes, they’re signed ‘Lord Cutler Beckett of the East India Trading Company.’

A truly discomforting notion, love.

Friendly?

Will strikes a deal for these and upholds it with honor, yet you are the one standing here with the prize.  As if I could be bought for such a low price.

You do know Will taught me how to handle a sword.

That’s foolish.
I imagine… some of your Crew may have jumped ship there.

Why not? We are very much alike you and I. I and you… us.
Except for a sense of honor and decency and a moral center. And personal hygiene.
Trifles. You Will come over to my side, I know it.
You seem very certain.
One word, love
Why doesn’t your compass work?
My compass works fine.
Because you and I are alike. And there Will come a moment when you have a chance to show it. To do the right thing.
I love those moments. I like to wave at them as they pass by.
You’ll have the chance to do something… something courageous. And when you, you’ll discover something. That you’re a good man.
All evidence to the contrary.
No, I have faith in you. You want to know why?
Do tell, dearie.
Curiosity. You’re going to want it – a chance to be admired – and gain the rewards that follow. You won’t be able to resist. You’re going to want to know what it tastes like.
I do want to know what it tastes like.
I’m proud of you, Jack.
I need my jar of dirt.
Guard the boat; mind the tides… don’t touch my dirt.
Yes, it does, you’re sitting on it.
Beg pardon?
It’s real.
I do that quite a lot, yet people are still surprised.
With good reason.
Will.
How did you get here?

Not so easy is it?

You do?
After you tricked me onto that ship, to square your debt with Jones.
What?
What?
I was reunited with my father.
Oh, well, you’re welcome, then.
Everything you said to me, every word was a lie!
Pretty much. Time and tide, love.  Oi, what are you doing?
I’m gonna kill Jones.
Can’t let you do that, William. ‘Cause if Jones is dead, who’s to call his terrible beastie off the hunt, eh?  The key.
I keep the promises I make, Jack. I intend to free my father. And I hope you’re here to see it.
I knew you’d warm up to me eventually.
Ah. The dark side of ambition.
Stop it!
Guard the chest.
No!
This is madness!
Be my guest.

Let us examine that claim for a moment, former Commodore, shall we? Who was it that at the very moment you had a notorious pirate safely behind bars saw fit to free said pirate and take your dearly beloved all to hisself… aye? So whose fault is it really that you’ve ended up a rum-pot deckhand what takes orders from pirates?
Oh.
Sword!
Hmm.
Oh, shut it.
Will.
Leave him lie! Unless you plan on using him to hit something with.

You’re mad.
I-I say we respect his final wish.

Norrington took it to draw them off.
Fell behind.
I’ve got a jar of di-irt, I’ve got a jar of di-irt, and guess what’s inside it?
Hard to starboard.
Hard to starboard!
Raise up the foreyard!
Make fast!
She’s falling behind!
We’re the faster?
We’ve got her advantage.
My father is on that ship. If we can outrun her, we can take her. We should turn and fight.
Why fight when you can negotiate? All one needs is the proper leverage.  Where is it? Where is the thump thump?
No. It’s not a reef!  Get away from the rail!

The Kraken. To arms!
It’ll attack the starboard, I’ve seen it before. Roll out the cannons and hold for my signal.
Easy boys.
Will?
Steady! Steady.
Will?
Hold. Hold!
Will!
Fire!  It’ll be back. We have to get off the ship.

As soon as you’re clear.

Haul away!
Hyah! Come on!
Abandon ship. Into the long boat.

...the bell has been raised from its watery grave; hear its sepulchral tone? A call to all, pay heed the squall, and turn your sails toward home!... yo ho, all together, hoist the colors high. Yo ho, thieves...

Jack Sparrow.  He’s one of the pirate lords.

Shall I?  That sort of thinking got us into this mess. Gentlemen, we have lost speed and therefore time, precious time, which cannot be regained once lost. Do you understand?

What are YOU doing?

That makes you...chart man!
You left Jack to the Kraken?

You chose not to tell me.
I couldn’t. It wasn’t your burden to bear.
But I did bear it, didn’t I? I just didn’t know what it was. I thought...
You thought I loved him.
If you make your choices alone, how can I trust you?
You can’t.
They’re not a threat to us, am I right?
It’s my father, we’ve made it back. Father here, look here!
Elizabeth, we’re not back.
Father!
No, no.
No, you can’t be!
Come aboard!
Someone cast a line!
Take the line!
Father, the line, take the line!
Father, come back with us! I won’t leave you!
Elizabeth.
Is there a way?
Why doesn’t he do something?
And the green flash happens at sunset, not sunrise.
UP IS DOWN. Well that’s just maddeningly unhelpful. Why are these things never clear?

I love the sea.
I prefer rum. Rum’s good.
Once every ten years.

Now up is down.

I is arguin’ the point. If there’s pirates a-gatherin’, I’m pointing my ship the other way.

I quite like the sound of that. Captain Jack Sparrow, the last pirate.

Why don’t you both go ashore and leave the ship in my command... temporarily.

He’s the captain.

Release her. She’s not part of the bargain.
Captain Turner?

Why didn’t you tell me you were planning this?

He needs the Pearl! Captain Turner needs the Pearl! And you felt guilty. And you and your Brethren Court! Did no one come to save me just because they missed me?  I’m standing over there with them.
I’m not certain I can survive any more visits from old friends.
What? What isn’t?

You can keep Barbossa, the belligerent homunculus and his friend with the wooden eye both, and Turner... especially Turner. What interest is she to you?
What?
Elizabeth is not part of any bargain!
It points to what you want most, and that’s not the Brethren Court, is it?
Me. Dead.
Done.

With me killed, you’d arrive at Shipwreck Cove, find its stronghold nigh impregnable, able to withstand blockade for years, and then you’d wish, “Oh, if only there were someone I had not killed inside to assure that the pirates then come outside...”
You may kill me, but you may never insult me. Who am I?  Done!
Thank goodness for that, because if I wasn’t, this would probably never work.
And that was without a single drop of rum.  Send this pestilent traitorous cowhearted yeasty codpiece to the brig.

We being who?

Me?

Me?

Bootstrap.

You haven’t raised an alarm.
Odd, isn’t it? But not as odd as this. Come up with this all by your lonesome, did you?
I said to myself, think like Jack.

And this is what you’ve arrived at? Lead Beckett to Shipwreck Cove so as to gain his trust, accomplish your own ends? It’s like you don’t know me at all, mate. And how does your dearly beloved feel about this?  Ah, you’ve not seen fit to trust her with it.
I’m losing her Jack. Every step I take for my father is a step away from Elizabeth.

Mate, if you choose to lock your heart away, you’ll lose it for certain. If I may lend a machete to your intellectual thicket—avoid the choice altogether. Change the facts. Let someone else dispatch Jones.
Who?  You?

Death has a curious way or reshuffling one’s priorities. I’ll slip aboard the Dutchman, find the heart, stab the beating thing. Your father goes free, and you’re free to be with your charming murderess.
And you’re willing to carve out your heart and bind yourself to the Dutchman, forever.
No mate, I’m free forever. Free to sail the seas beyond the edges of the map, free from death itself.
You’ve got to do the job though, Jack. You have to ferry souls to the next world. Or end up just like Jones.
I don’t have the face for tentacles. But immortal has to count for something, eh? Oh!
What’s this for?
Think like me, it’ll come to you.  My regards to Davy Jones!
I hate him.
What are you doing?
It’s too late to earn my forgiveness.
Come with us. James, come with me.
You’re lying.
James! James! No!
For all that pirates are clever cobs, we are an unimaginative lot when it comes to naming things.
I once sailed with a geezer lost both of his arms and part of his eye.
Larry.
Not yours, his. Jack Sparrow sends his regards.
You’ve not told him? We rescued Jack from the locker along with the Black Pearl.
Not quite so well actually. The Brethren Court intends to release her.
You loved her. She’s the one, and then you betrayed her.
And after which betrayal did you cut out your heart, I wonder?
I hadn’t finished that. You will free my father.  And you will guarantee Elizabeth’s safety, along with my own.
Calypso is aboard the Black Pearl. Jack has sailed the Black Pearl to Shipwreck Cove.
What is it you want most?

Might I point out that we are still short one pirate lord, and I’m content as a cucumber to wait until Sao Feng joins us.
Sao Feng is dead. He fell to the Flying Dutchman.
And made you captain? They’re just giving the bloody title away now.

We fight!
Shoot him and cut out his tongue, then shoot his tongue. And trim that scraggly beard.

Cuttlefish. Let us not, dear friends, forget our dear friends the cuttlefish. Flippant glorious little sausages. Pen ‘em up together and they’ll devour each other without a second thought. Human nature, isn’t it?...or....or fish nature.  So yes, we could hole up here well provisioned and well armed and half of us would be dead within the month, which seems grim to me any way you slice it. Or, as my learned colleague so naively suggests, we could release Calypso, and we can pray that she will be merciful. I rather doubt it. Can we in fact pretend that she is anything other than a woman scorned, like which fury hell hath no? We cannot. Res ipso loquitur tabula in naufragio , we are left with but one option. I agree with, and I cannot believe the words are comin’ out of me mouth, Captain Swann. We must fight.
I have not!
Have not!
Have not!
Have not, slander and calumny! I have only ever embraced that oldest and noblest of pirate traditions. I submit here and now, that is what we all must do, we must fight... to run away.
You made that up.

I call for a vote.
Elizabeth Swann.
Elizabeth Swann.

Of the Brethren Court. Courtesy of Jack.

You’re right. Then what shall we die for?  You will listen to me. Listen! The brethren will still be looking here to us, to the Black Pearl to lead, and what will they see?
